meta.title: OpenC2 ISR Actuator Profile
meta.description: Stripped down schema for JCAUS commands and responses.

types: The task or activity to be performed (i.e., the 'verb').
The object of the action. The action is performed on the target.
The subject of the action. The actuator executes the action on the target.
Additional information that applies to the command.
Identifier used to link responses to a command.
Returns the current configuration of the device
Find an object physically, logically, functionally, or by organization.
Task an entity to provide information to a designated recipient.
Duplicate an object,  file, data flow or artifact.
A set  of commands you wish to send to a device
An array of bytes representing a file-like object or a link to that object.
The properties of a hardware device.
A set of items used with the query action to determine an actuator's capabilities
Actuator specifiers and options as defined in the isr profile.
Specific known frequency of a signal of interest
The lowest frequency value in a range
The uppermost frequency value in a range
The specific date/time to initiate the action
The specific date/time to terminate the action
The length of time for an action to be in effect
The type of response required for the action: **none, ack, status, complete**. When not explicitly contained in an OpenC2 Command, a Consumer MUST responde the same as response type complete.
Command arguments defined in the isr profile
The lowest frequency value in a range
The uppermost frequency value in a range
A free-form human-readable description of the response status
Data or extended status information that was requested from an OpenC2 command
ID of the command that induced this response
ID of the actuator sending the response
ID of the actuator sending the response
An interim response used to inform the client that the server has accepted the request but not yet completed it.
The target resource has been assigned a new permanent URI
The server cannot process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax.)
The request lacks valid authentication credentials for the target resources or authorization has been refused for the submitted credentials.
The server understood the request but refuses to authorize it.
The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.
The server does not support the functionality required to fulfill the request.
Specifiers defined in the Example Inc. extension profile
Permitted values specified in the IANA Media Types registry
choice of literal content or URL to obtain content
Specifies a dictionary of hashes for the contents of the payload
A hostname that can be used to connect to this device over a network
A human-readable description of the purpose, relevance, and/or properties of the device
An identifier that refers to this device within an inventory or management system
The name of the file as defined in the file system
The absolute path to the location of the file in the file system
One or more cryptographic hash codes of the file contents
A target used to query Actuator for its supported capabilities
Current working directory of the process
Executable that was executed to start the process
The full command line invocation used to start this process, including all arguments
The name that uniquely identifies a property of an actuator.
A query string that identifies a single property of an actuator. The syntax of the query string is defined in the actuator profile
MD5 hash as defined in RFC3121
SHA1 hash as defined in RFC3174
Specifies the data contained in the artifact.
MUST be a valid URL that resolves to the un-encoded content
Service Name or Transport Protocol Port Number, RFC 6335
Results to be included in response to query openc2 command
OpenC2 language versions supported by this actuator
List of profiles supported by this actuator
Definition of the command syntax supported by this actuator
List of supported actions and applicable targets
Respond with progress toward command completion
Respond when all aspects of command completed
Syntax of the OpenC2 language elements supported by this actuator
List of targets applicable to each supported action
The t= date/time an event is detected/witnessed
The latitude/longitude pair of a target's geolocation
Specific known frequency of a signal of interest
An action supported by this actuator
List of targets applicable to this action
